annotation.TEXT: Now, here's how this works: LRP basically divides the field into five sections with lasers, and you have to stand in a particular section, or you're screwed. Begin by standing in the top-center section.
This shouldn't be too hard, but the frequency of the spinning square matrices' appearances increases as time goes on, so don't spend too long on this spell.

And for the final round, go to the lower-right section, and dodge through the cluster of white bullets. So, to reiterate, go to the sections in this order: Top-center, bottom-left, upper-right, upper-left, bottom-right.
Huh? "So far"? What's meant by "so far"? Find out next time! To be continued...
Totally awesome! And this spell does appear on the spell card practice list (unlike the stage 6B boss's "last spells"), so you can try it again whenever you want once you've reached it here once!

However, the real strength of this team is in the Remilia-like shot. When you focus, these "barrels of doom" familiars get placed where you started focusing, and they will remain there, shooting forward, until you unfocus again. Meanwhile, you can move and shoot elsewhere.
3rd

And also, you've got this "Music Room", just like in your traditional Touhou games, which is awesome. But... The four tunes that play during the Phantasm stage (1st half, midboss/2nd half, boss battle, and the last spell "xync") aren't on the list for some reason... The last tune on this list is the Extra boss's theme.

One really neat thing about this is that your "Score", "Life", "Power", and "Point" values all carry over from the Extra stage when you warp here! (Unlike with PCB, where its Phantasm stage is completely separate, and you always start with a blank slate there.)
Okay, now for Locker Room Production's "last spell", which screwed me over last time, because I didn't do it right!

What's this? It shot out some squares horizontally, which then split apart vertically. Good thing I wasn't up there at the time! If you're going to circle around the boss, try to time it so that it isn't launching those squares while you're up there.
While here, dodge some red shots and maybe graze a laser if you want.

"TILE"... Now, most of the time, you want to be relatively close to the boss, within the green tiled lines it forms around itself. But don't get closer than necessary, as it's firing off tiny purple squares as well.
5th
After that, another corridor with bar boundaries appears, so move towards the center. You can relax here for a few seconds, but it's not quite over just yet!
For the third round, move into the upper-right section here, and play some dodgeball. (But only dodge, and don't try to catch them!)
Hopefully, the RNG won't deal you an unwinnable hand here, but usually, there'll be enough room for you to dodge when needed.
Hey, it kind of looks like he's sitting in a "Yukari" gap as well.
Okay, 4.30 power at this point, just like usual for me, and that's all I need!
However, Matatabi Asobi is kind of out of luck for that spell, and will have to settle for a time out if they use that trick. (But the graze and relative safety may be worth it anyway!)

After that will be the usual group of five fairies, but take them out fast. The boss is approaching, and it isn't going to wait for you to finish them off! (If you take too long, the fairies can still be there and shooting at you during the boss fight!)

Here's how I handle this part: I start at the upper-left corner, and slowly move down as they fire, but speeding up for one brief part. This works for me, but there may be an easier way to dodge them. I just haven't bothered looking for one.
Fifth spell, which I like to call the "spinning square matrix" spell!
The second nonspell is just like the first (once again), so you can take it easy for a bit.
1st
So, we've got these expanding and contracting snowflake-like shot patterns. Looks potentially tricky, but it's really very similar to the stage 3 boss's "Simple Gimmick".
However, not everyone can use that trick to capture that spell. Clairvoyance has homing shots, Tetla Pot can aim the "Youmu" familiar at the boss, and Maribel Han has the "barrels of doom".
Okay, now get ready to start dodging some bars. These are bars you don't want to walk into!
So, just move around to bait the aimed snowflakes in easy-to-dodge directions, maybe circling around the boss if you like. Shouldn't be that hard to capture.
Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching me play through Project Nize Festival... so far.
Also, listen closely to the music. It sounds like a combination of IN's first stage and PCB's first stage. Interesting...

You'll be just about perfectly safe and can get lots of graze, and you'll only have to move if one of the single cyan shots comes your way. You won't have to worry about the spreads at all, since they always go downwards!
Sixth and final nonspell. By this point, the bullet density is pretty high, but it shouldn't be unreasonable, and there's still the large openings on the sides that you can use if you want.
For the first several seconds, just stay in the middle. But, be ready. Eventually you're gonna have to start really dodging stuff!

Okay, so it wasn't that much faster (What? Were you expecting DPS rivaling Marisa B from MoF?), but I was free to move around to avoid things while letting the barrels do their job, and that freedom of mobility can be very useful on some spell cards!
So my plan for right now is, just damage the boss as fast as possible to limit how long I have to dodge through this!
Okay, now "Sakuya" has a three-way shot when I reached 1.00 power, but I think the "barrels of doom" are still better.
Final regular spell, "denotation". Randomly aimed lines of squares will enter the screen from random spots, so stay away from the edges of the field, and dodge them as needed.
Just look at how fast those "barrels of doom" are firing now, and how fast the midboss's life bar is draining!

Next, you'll have to dodge through some random blocks that get more and more dense for a time. Oh, and you can still try grazing these things, or the bars making up the edges of the corridor if you're daring.

Phantasm stage?! Yeah, if you capture "Synergy V", you get warped straight to a hidden Phantasm stage! (However, I don't know if there are any other requirements, such as how you have to have also captured 60 spell cards total in Perfect Cherry Blossom.)
Alright, next dodge around some randomly placed bars up ahead. This can get real tricky.
There's a quick post-battle conversation this time, then the stage continues (and still while playing this music, which is cool).
It only took me 11 seconds to take out that spell card (compared to just over 12 seconds with Tetla Pot last episode)!
This nonspell isn't tough. Just weave between the bullets, or utilize the obvious openings on the sides if you want.
Now, this guy's third spell is not gonna be easy. When it first starts, try to do as much damage as you can early on, before the bullets start crowding you.
Didn't Sakuya in IN start with a slight spread in her shot, even when at 0 power?
And finally, move to the center and enter the portal to victory!
Hello, and welcome back to yet another episode of Project Nize Festival!
I'm going to go through the Extra stage again, and this time, I'll be using the Sakuya/Remilia-like team, Maribel Han!
And here's our Phantasm boss, a cube! There's no dialogue preceding this fight, so the battle gets underway immediately! (Hopefully, you've already taken out all of those fairies!)

However, they're really dense, and like to change directions suddenly, and this time, I don't know of any blind spot or trick to help deal with that, making this one of the hardest spells in this game for me to capture!
And once again, dodge the spell circles' attacks the same way as before. However...

Okay, now we get to do this again, but we have to stand in a different section now. Go to the lower-left section this time. (Also, this is a survival spell, in case you couldn't tell, so you can't finish it off quickly through damage.)
First of all, the waves of triangular bullets are aimed at you, so sidestep them or bait them or whatever.

Alright, here we go again! First of all, the Sakuya-like character gets just a basic shot when you have no power. You will eventually start getting a spread shot after powering up, but I don't think it's as good as the Yuyuko-like character's shot. It still has its uses though.
And the game is won! But, we've got one more very special "last spell" left, and it's so special, you'll face it regardless of whether you've died or met the point quota!
As for this nonspell, it's really no problem, and it's even possible to "Icicle Fall -Easy-" it, if you know what I mean!
For the fourth round, go over to the upper-left section, and get out of the way of some fast-moving bullets. These bullets are not aimed, so you just have to stand in the right spots to dodge them.
And just remember that the hitboxes of the large balls isn't quite as big as they look, so you should be able to squeeze through, even if it appears that you're trapped.
However, if you don't get within those green tile lines, you're not totally screwed. It's possible to squeeze in between the green tiles as they peel off.

It shoots out the first set of squares about 14 seconds into the spell, and then about every 7 seconds after that. Oh, and most of the previous squares will still be lingering on the screen, so try to finish this spell as quickly as you can.
Now, for this spell card, there is a MUCH easier way to handle it than how I did last time. Just move into one of the upper corners!

Oh, and while the corridor boundary bars are gone now, there's still a limit to how far you can move in any direction, so try not to move too much, or you might find yourself hitting the limit at the wrong time!
Alright, let's quickly finish off this spell and get to the real reason I decided to replay the Extra stage!
The enemy patterns are the same as in the Extra stage, except they fire more rapidly, and with greater numbers of faster bullets. Be ready for this!

Once again, though, it's tricky, so don't be afraid to use up one bomb here, which you'll probably be reimbursed for right away from all the items present. (However, looking back, I saw a way I could've gotten past that without having to bomb there.)
Just a couple seconds left...

If you're using the "barrels of doom", I recommend keeping them in the center. Regardless of the team, while you may want to stay in front of the boss to deal maximum damage, prioritize finding safe openings first.
4th
"Barrels of doom" really help out here. The other shot types will definitely take a lot longer to clear this spell.
Now, for his first spell, it's sort of like Marisa's "Asteroid Belt" or maybe "Non-Directional Laser" (but without the lasers) from IN, and it's quite tricky!
Fourth nonspell. You know the deal. Unlike with the Extra boss, there's no oddities in this thing's spell/nonspell pattern.
Next, the dot matrices (with or without stereo sound-- it depends on your PC's sound system I guess). This doesn't seem as tricky as those bars I just went through, though.

"fire and motion"... Now those dots are sort of chasing you, so try to stay away. It is semi-random though. Sometimes, the dots won't seem to be gunning for you, and other times, they'll be after you like a hawk. Hopefully, you won't get cornered!
When the bullets do approach, back off, and try to find routes through them.
So, yep, the same strategies for dealing with the enemies in Extra apply here as well, except you just have to watch out for the increased bullet intensity.
I hope you're not claustrophobic!
Wh-whoa! What just happened?

Actually, a couple more things to mention: You can unlock challenging "Last Word" spell cards in spell card practice, just like in IN, but I'm not entirely sure about all of their unlocking conditions, though I think clearing Phantasm with each team unlocks the four at the very end of the list (one unlock per team).
Well, those dots didn't seem to be very bloodthirsty for me that time, which was nice.

Third nonspell. Same deal, but... Wait a minute... This particular nonspell has "Icicle Fall -Easy-" type safe spots! This is the only one of its nonspells that's like this. May as well take advantage of it!
You've got to slip through a couple of sets of stripes up ahead, which I do sometimes fail at.
It should be easy enough to dodge the blue strings here, but just note that they change course a bit about halfway out. (Don't worry about being surprised at the bottom of the screen, though!)
Oh, there's additional spell circles this time. These pairs are not tricky at all to evade, but, the final pattern of them that's coming up is definitely harder.
And here we have this game's second midboss. I'm... not exactly sure what he's supposed to be, but he's wearing a green hat.
"Simplicity"... Okay, you've got a maze of blinking squares creeping towards you, and you have to find a way through them. With every blink, they move a little bit further downward.
Oh, and he's got a "last spell" as well. If you have "barrels of doom" with at least 4.00 power, that'll make this one a bit easier.
The screen won't turn white on you here, so there's no need to worry about blurriness this time.
And then it's back to the title screen like usual. Alright, I think I've covered just about everything in this game...
The second nonspell is just like the first, except the bullets are slightly closer together. This trend will continue with all of its nonspells.
2nd
Do quick dodges through those gaps in the fast white and green bullets while avoiding the slower blue ones!

However, see those green bullets that are approaching? Yeah, you're gonna have to start dodging through them too, but if you've had >=4.00 power "barrels of doom" pounding the boss the entire time, you'll barely have to dodge any of the green bullets!
Of course, this is most useful when the boss is sitting still, so maybe the first spell card will make for a better example to show this off.
Next, the post-midboss enemies are just like in the Extra stage once again. The spread shot type does come in handy here.
Well anyway, let's just keep putting the hurt on these enemies, and make sure we have at least 4.00 power upon reaching the midboss.
Don't panic. They slow down to a reasonable enough to dodge speed as they expand towards you. Also, dodge some spread shots while you're at it.
And there's still one last conversation where they're talking about who knows what.
"Slicebeat"... This is one of the harder spell cards. Oh, it may not look like much at the moment, with just aimed lines of bullets to dodge, best done by circling the boss, but just wait.
"xync"... It's got its own music, it lasts for two minutes, and has a unique gameplay element where you're flying towards the stuff in the background (just like Star Fox)!
Also, only a few of the shot patterns are actually aimed at you. The rest follow a fixed pattern. So, you shouldn't have to move around too much.

Ooh, now the 160 million point 1-up comes at a more relevant time. (Also, I think the next 1-up is at 370 million, but I'm not going to reach that mark in this video. Scoring that high involved tons of graze farming!)
For this spell card, keep your "barrels of doom" in the center. The cube moves around a lot, but passes through the center often enough for the barrels to still deal a decent amount of damage.

On top of that, if you have at least 4.00 power, I do believe that those "barrels of doom" have a higher damage output per unit of time (or DPS, which stands for "damage per second") than anyone else's shot in the game!
"Pray for Snow"? No way! After what happened to us on October 29th last year, that's one of the last things I'd want to pray for!
(Isn't "Maribel Han" the name of an official Touhou character that's in one of the print works or something?)

I'm getting lucky with the openings here, but if you find yourself in a tight spot, remember that you can pass through the squares while they are "off", but it's risky, so I'd do that only as a last resort.
